name: nytimes
text:
President Trump attended several large gatherings in the days before he tested positive for the coronavirus. 

Seven people who attended one of them, a nominating ceremony for Judge Amy Coney Barrett at the White House, have since tested positive. https://t.co/ldZxPVEPf7

name: nytimes
text:
Six of the seven people who tested positive, including the first lady, sat in the first several rows of the ceremony in the Rose Garden. The seventh was the president himself.

Few people at the outdoor ceremony wore masks or kept their social distance. https://t.co/3QDMAl9bIl https://t.co/nS3RWQ9Qr9

name: nytimes
text:
But experts say the more risky time that day was at the reception indoors, where transmission of the virus tends to happen.

Gatherings where guests are maskless and in tight quarters can be a recipe for “super spreader” events, research shows. https://t.co/3QDMAl9bIl https://t.co/zj7VRCHavm

name: nytimes
text:
Inside the White House, President Trump mingled with Judge Barrett, her family and prominent Republicans. 

Some of those in attendance have since tested positive for the virus. https://t.co/3QDMAl9bIl https://t.co/rGExneWdVD

name: nytimes
text:
We've been tracing where President Trump traveled and the people with whom he met in the days before he tested positive for the coronavirus.

And we’ve been tracking who has tested positive or negative so far from those events.
https://t.co/BlSwIjxorM

name: nytimes
text: Last week, in addition to the ceremony for Judge Barrett, President Trump attended meetings and news conferences at the White House and several large gatherings, including the presidential debate in Ohio and rallies in Pennsylvania and Minnesota. https://t.co/BlSwIjxorM https://t.co/VfsMaH7lGG

name: nytimes
text:
As President Trump spends his third day in the hospital, we continue to monitor test results from those who were near him.

We’ll be updating our tracing efforts throughout the day. 
https://t.co/3QDMAl9bIl
